Text: The Leda is a river in north-western Germany in the state of Lower Saxony.
Triplets:<The Leda
1:
--------------------
Text: Leda (river):  It is a right tributary of the Ems and originates at the confluence of the Sagter Ems and the Soeste (Dreyschloot) near the town of Barßel.
Triplets:<Leda
2:
--------------------
Text: Leda (river):  The Leda flows into the Ems near the town of Leer.

Triplets:<Leda
3:
--------------------
Text: Leda (river):  On the southern bank of the Leda, in the "Overledingen Land" (Overledingen="country over the Leda"), opposite Leer, lies the small settlement of Kloster Muhde ("Muhde" from the Old Frisian "mutha" meaning "(river) mouth").
